field.name: summary
field.value: incorrect component configuration results in an 'The container seems to be unavailable in your HttpApplication subclass' exception.

field.name: description
field.value:
I just went through a very long try / error session with an IIS webserver :/ Some stupid programmer (me) had corrupted the component.config file and I couldn't figure out what was wrong with the site.
this is the content of the file:
<component id="templateengine" service="Castle.Components.Common.TemplateEngine.ITemplateEngine, Castle.Components.Common.TemplateEngine" type="Castle.Components.Common.TemplateEngine.NVelocityTemplateEngine.NVelocityTemplateEngine, Castle.Components.Common.TemplateEngine.NVelocityTemplateEngine"> <parameters> <templateDir>#{templateDirectory}</templateDir> </parameters> </component>
The source of the error is that I removed the 'templateDirectory' parameter from the property file because we aren't using it anymore but I forgot to remove the component.
On IIS the exception thrown by the XMLconfig reader is discarded, and I don't know why. The next exception in the line is 'The container seems to be unavailable in your HttpApplication subclass'', not very helpful.
It took me quite long time to figure that one out and I really have no idea why IIS suppresses the exception thrown by the XmlConfig reader. Could this be a server setting or can we alter the MR initialization so these error's find there way to the surface?
